entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Albus Dumbledore, once Supreme Mugwump of the International Confederation of Wizards and Chief Warlock of the Wizengamot, is mentioned as the headmaster of Hogwarts. He has made eccentric decisions in the last few years.

entities.name: remus lupin
entities.description: Remus Lupin, a werewolf, was hired by Dumbledore as a staff member at Hogwarts.

entities.name: rubeus hagrid
entities.description: Rubeus Hagrid, a half-giant, was also hired by Dumbledore as a staff member at Hogwarts.

entities.name: mad-eye moody
entities.description: Mad-Eye Moody, an ex-Auror, is described as 'delusional' and was also hired by Dumbledore as a staff member at Hogwarts.

entities.name: griselda marchbanks
entities.description: Griselda Marchbanks, a Wizengamot elder, resigned in protest against the introduction of the post of Inquisitor to Hogwarts.

entities.name: tiberius ogden
entities.description: Tiberius Ogden, another Wizengamot elder, also resigned in protest against the introduction of the post of Inquisitor to Hogwarts.

entities.name: ministry
entities.description: The Ministry is mentioned as keeping an eye on the situation at Hogwarts.

relationships.description: Remus Lupin was hired by Dumbledore as a staff member at Hogwarts.
Rubeus Hagrid was also hired by Dumbledore as a staff member at Hogwarts.
Mad-Eye Moody, an ex-Auror, was also hired by Dumbledore as a staff member at Hogwarts.
The Ministry is keeping an eye on the situation at Hogwarts, implying they are monitoring Dumbledore's actions.
Griselda Marchbanks resigned in protest against the introduction of the post of Inquisitor to Hogwarts, indicating she is opposed to it.
Tiberius Ogden also resigned in protest against the introduction of the post of Inquisitor to Hogwarts, indicating he is opposed to it.
